m_szDocTitle: Interconnected Graphene-Carbon Nanotube Network Can Store Large Amount of Energy
m_szDocSumamry: textArticle -------------------- Interconnected Graphene-Carbon Nanotube Network Can Store Large Amount of Energy Published on May 12, 2014 at 7:25 AM Written by AZoNanoMay 12 2014 Scientists have taken a large step toward making a fiber-like energy storage device that can be woven into clothing and power wearable medical monitors, communications equipment or other small electronics. The device is a supercapacitor—a cousin to the battery. This one packs an interconnected network of graphene and carbon nanotubes so tightly that it stores energy comparable to some thin-film lithium batteries—an
